column5: Thanks tibbs..... it sure was.
thats an awesome laker lake..you guys are lucky out here in zone 9 everything closes november 30th...even perch!!
Great report and pics Leechman.  Those steaks look might fine as well.
great report thanks for sharing!!!  cheers!

just finished eating that whitie!  and the rumours are TRUE!!!!!!!!!!  white fish = #1 MEAT in the WORLD!!  thanx for de advice guys on how to catch and how to fix these types of fish!  Now i have to go buy me some more BAD BOYZ! and some fishfry!  landed all my fish with this lure!  leechman did verry well with his swedish pimple!  whitespinnerbait landed the last oos with his silver and red williams white fish spoon!  still having a litle probleme tho!  seems like nothing is hitting on the tip ups!  any advice on how we should be rigging our tip ups?  we tried a small dead minnow without any success!  thanx again guys!

Yeah Carl it sure is....  very healthy population of lakers and well managed, the water is crystal clear.    That really suck about the close date of all species.  Does it reopen for hard water??   Thanks fishnsled!   Thanks lunkerbasshunter!
Fantastic report and pics.  WTG guys
Thanks MJL!
great looking whitefish!
great day nice white congrats
Thanks Mattk!   Thanks corvette!
and then this    Tell me you didnt.LOL I know ya didnt.  Great photos and thats one chunky whitie.
Thanks Brian..... The does were within arrow range     would of been real good on the BBQ
nope closed all winter,ive always wondered why
Bummer Carl, do you ice fish?  If so, where do you go since all species are closed Nov 30th in zone 9?
i icefish about 3-4 times a winter on lac des deux montagnes (zone 8)for walleye, i get enough fishing done in the summer that i mostly snowmobile all winter and enjoy the great scenery
I just googlemap "lac des deux montagnes" to see where it was and man that's a big body of water Any decent size eyes in that lake and what other species can you target??
Excellent report, thanks for posting.  Looks like a great time up there
Thanks Lexx..... going out tomorrow morning, same lake, hope to get my first whitie
wicked whitefish!!
Thanks gozwob!

Well guys the plan today was for Whitespinnerbait , Fishing 24/7 and I to head out to Lac 31 Miles and try for the first time for whities.   Left home at 7:00am, temperature was -24C and little overcast.  Snow was lightly coming down while driving.   Got to destination at around 9ish and just before driving onto the lake..... a couple of these guys stop for a quick snapshot    A doe and her fawn.....  There were tracks everywhere  24/7 knows a good spot on that lake but unfortunately for us the path on the ice road to that spot was covered in deep snow and being in a sunfire did not venture there    Instead we tried another spot.... got setup and did not take long for Kevin aka Fishing 24/7 to hook into a beautiful laker..... but no pics of that one, back she goes..... OOS  Then it was Paul's turn to hook into a decent fish but never seen the color of it because his line got snapped  Kevin got another laker and back she went..... we moved to another location near some islands in about 20 FOW.... I managed my first laker on a Swedish Pimple tipped with a white Gulp fish fry..... back she went  I got into another and lost it at the hole      Kevin took some shots while I was fighting it.... here they are        Man that thing was huge and fortunately for her she spit my spoon at the hole..... Then not long after Kevin hooks into his first whitie     and what a beauty    Took another shot of it    All in all was beautiful day, caught 7 lakers and one whitie Thanks Kevin and Paul for a fun day..... we'll definitely do it again Hope you enjoy Leechman
Awesome day...bet you can't wait 'til the lakers are in season    Thanks for posting
Excellent photos. Thanks for sharing...
Sounds like a great/fishful day on the hardwater !!!!.  ..nice whitie too...cheers
Nice pictures, nice whitie! Good report!
Thanks for sharing.  That whitie would taste mighty nice baked or BBQ'd
Very nice report, fish, and pics Jacques!!!  Looks like it was plenty cold, but when the fish are biting it doesn't feel as cold as it actually is eh!!!
i told ya i'd be waiting for a report!!! and a darn good one at that, nice lookin' white  and 7 lakers! sounds like a good day no matter how chilly it was!  thanks for sharin' Matt!

Thanks johnnyb.... Yeah LOL wished they were...... Man can they ever put up a fight   Thanks Danc.... wish I could of taken a shot of the sunfire where we ended last     Lots of snow and couldn't go any further.   Thanks fishindevil..... Yeah that whitie sure is a beaut.

Thanks Rico24.   Thanks Bruce..... Unfortunately for me did not hook into one..... Bet Kevin is enjoying it   Thanks Glen.  Sure was cold today but like you said, after my first hookup with them lakers, did not feel as cold as it actually was.   Thanks Matt.  It was darn cold in the early parts of the morning but warmed up to a toasty -13C    and that is without the wind chill.

Was real fun to finaly get out and enjoi some of quebecs best winter days! COLD COLD COLD BUT sunny!  we went on the whitefish hunt ended up getting OOS lakers......  good thing i got that single BEAST! tho. totally different fighters than lakers.  now the good part enjoying a good OL FEAST OF THE BEAST!  they gave me two monster fillets ! thanx for the great advice guys!  hope oyu enjoi LEECHMANS REPORT!  next time we will try deeper and try to find the school of them! that is if we can!  that lake is enfested with LA GRISE!!!!!!  till next time!  24/7

Thanks Kev..... that was a beautiful whitie beast you caught and wish I could of somehow hook into one but nonetheless was a real fun day out there and will have to do it again...... Congratulations Kev..... U the man!!!!! Hoping that Paul got some pics to share Jacques
Bien joué mon grand!!  En passant, c'est dans quel ZEC que t'as pêché?  Dommage que la grise était fermé...  On dirai que y'en manque pas!!  prends soins HD
Good job guys!

Merci mon Chum!  Ont n'était pas dans aucun ZEC mais sur un plan d'eau que j'ai jamais fréquenté dans la zone 10  près de chez nous    Ben du fun mais comme tu as dit, vraiment dommage que la grise était fermée.... de très beau spéciments....  Le plan d'eau est très bien aménagé et ils sont en abondances  Merci encore!    Thanks weedline.... Much appreciated!

Sure was a beautiful day to be outdoors.....    Man the Lakers were on fire !!!!!!!!  Since 24/7 gauranteed his girlfriend that he would be bringing home whitefish for supper..    I settled for a meal with a t-bone and not a y-bone       Here my catch of the day....      The Three Amigo's .

Good job lads! My place in QC is infested with whitefish as well. Although I havn't been up in the winter very much, the few times I have I've never been able to locate numbers of them.  I have caught tons of them in late June when the mayflies hatch in the evening. My entire bay is teeming with rising fish then....  One of these days I'll figure them out! Good luck to you guys hopefully you can crack the code.
Good job the Amigos!!!!
Good job guys
Nice to see that the 3 of you were able to get out  ...nice report and that's a beauty Whitie Kevin   ...  Wow Paul, I know that you like to eat.... but 4 T-Bones ??

Another mini OFC G2G!  Great job on you three hooking up on a cold winters day!  I don't ice fish much, but when I do go out it's always a great time.  At least you got into a few...I didn't have nearly the same luck this past weekend...LOL.  Great pics!
Great report fellas!  Thats a great looking whitefish!

Yeah Paul sure was a beauty day to be out..... Thanks again.  Will have to do it again soon     The T-bones sure looks good   Thanks Mike..... Interesting, where abouts is your place in QC?   Thanks Dan!
Thanks DGC   Thanks Steve..... nice and fat   Thanks Cliff..... Saw your report and looked like you guys had a blast nonetheless.... Thank you for that   Thanks buckster!
Great Report!  Looks like a blast!
